TopicTitle: The Plywood Flyer v0.1 [Kerbals strapped to plywood!]

Articles.Content:
New! A sheet of wood to put kerbals on!

Download from dropbox!

Download from mediafire!

Install: Just put the 'plankpod' folder into your parts folder. No mess no fuss.

Kerbal model by prefim! I gave the Kerbals eyes, and Jeb a pair of glasses. Also changed their faces to more match ingame ones.

Epic work!!!

At first glance I thought, hang on his eyes have gone but then I spotted the aviators!!!!!

Lovin it!
Re-entry might hurt, but.. for science! Great work

You inspired me!

Riding the Europallet!!!! - Just sat there because safety costs money so no duct tape!

You are welcome to the model if you want to add it to the pack.

Mat
Best. Derivatives. Ever.
I can\'t stop laughing, you clever bastard.
lmfao
We need a giant jeb head as a command pod.

New! A sheet of wood to put kerbals on!

Download from dropbox!

Download from mediafire!

Install: Just put the 'plankpod' folder into your parts folder. No mess no fuss.

Kerbal model by prefim! I gave the Kerbals eyes, and Jeb a pair of glasses. Also changed their faces to more match ingame ones.

Ok, you win the game.
Now animate their faces corresponding to their reactions on the lower right corner.

Now animate their faces corresponding to their reactions on the lower right corner.

Unfortunately unity doesn\'t yet support animation.

Unfortunately unity doesn\'t yet support animation.

Once more, YES IT DOES. It\'s the runtime model loading that doesn\'t, because unity has no native support for runtime loading. And since it\'s a very necessary component to be able to mod KSP, it\'s not going soon, although if I recall Harv said he might try to find a solution.

Loving the plywood! A cheaper alternative to having a proper command module!

Once more, YES IT DOES. It\'s the runtime model loading that doesn\'t, because unity has no native support for runtime loading. And since it\'s a very necessary component to be able to mod KSP, it\'s not going soon, although if I recall Harv said he might try to find a solution.

Damn... I hope there is a solution... That is gonna be vital for E.V.As isn\'t it?

Loving the plywood! A cheaper alternative to having a proper command module!

Damn... I hope there is a solution... That is gonna be vital for E.V.As isn\'t it?

well in orbiter we can do EVA\'s and they don\'t have any animations so no its not THAT vital
I meant having Kerbals popping out and doing EVAs. I was assuming that was how it was gonna work?
Dammit, why does a plank of wood with some Kerbals on it explode? I mean I craft the simplest rocket I can think of, a booster and the plank and it explodes before the booster does.

I meant having Kerbals popping out and doing EVAs. I was assuming that was how it was gonna work?

Boy, if you have to come here to get an explanation on how to pop out Kerbals, I think you\'re way off.

(Awesome mod, by the way)
its not working for me
NVM it works now

...

Jeb is happy. One booster with this straight to escape velocity.
Now THAT\'S KERBAL!

Once more, YES IT DOES. It\'s the runtime model loading that doesn\'t, because unity has no native support for runtime loading. And since it\'s a very necessary component to be able to mod KSP, it\'s not going soon, although if I recall Harv said he might try to find a solution.

Oh well, I was misinformed. I\'d really like Harv to put that in soon, but its probably in progress.
Nice. How did I miss this? Oh, PS, where can I get some lander legs for the mun?

You inspired me!

Riding the Europallet!!!! - Just sat there because safety costs money so no duct tape!

You are welcome to the model if you want to add it to the pack.

Mat

I\'d love to use that! Upload?

One little change for this would be good. Perhaps SOME way to make the experience survivable for the boys?

Maybe even at the Parachute signal the three kerbonauts disappear to be replaced by the parachuting kerbonauts seen in another mod?
